message_1: Let X = {1, 2, 3, 4} and consider a topology on X in which every subset of X is open. Determine whether or not this topology is compact.
message_2:
To determine whether this topology is compact, we need to check if every open cover of X has a finite subcover.

The given topology is the discrete topology, where every subset of X is open. Let's consider an open cover of X, which consists of the singletons {1}, {2}, {3}, and {4}. This open cover is already finite, and it covers the entire set X.

Since every open cover of X has a finite subcover (in this case, the open cover itself), the topology on X is compact.
